Job Posting:170488 - Position: F25 Data Analyst (Co-op) 170488 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 06/23/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 06/09/2025 09:58 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Maple Reinders Inc. Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description Data Analyst (Co-op) ID 2025-2708 2025 - Fall F25 Data Analyst (Co-op) 170488 Co-op Position Burnaby, BC Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List $21-$26 / hour, based on applicable education and experience. Preferred Co-op Term: 4 months (Starting September 2025) Location: Mississauga, ON or Burnaby, BC Maple Reinders Constructors is currently searching for a Data Analyst (Co-op Student) to join our operations team. As a Data Analyst (Co-op Student) in our operations division, you will have the opportunity to mine and analyze construction project and financial reporting data stored in various spreadsheets, identify trends, issues and opportunities to improve effectiveness & efficiency. As Maple Reinders is a growing organization, we are continually winning new work, larger projects and with that come new experiences and new challenges. As a Data Analyst (Co-op Student) you will be involved in the following tasks: • Design, build and maintain analytical models that mine large sets of structured and semi-structured data looking for unique insights and correlations. • Applies intellectual curiosity and deep analytical thinking to mine large data sets for insight and correlation. • Develop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunities. • Distil data into findings and prepare results for presentation to management for decision making. Engage stakeholders to understand informational pain points and drive analytics solution that address them. • Pay Rate: $21-$26 / hour, based on applicable education and experience. We want you to succeed and we are prepared to get you there by investing in you. If you are interested in a career with Maple Reinders, please submit your resume. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer and supports employment equity and diversity in the workplace. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, and others who reflect our ever-changing workplace. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process. Job Requirements To be considered for this role you will have and or be: • A full-time student enrolled in a related post-secondary program of study • Recent graduate of a University Degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management or Business Management • Excellent communication and presentation skills. Experience working in Microsoft Excel, database management, and preforming data manipulation and reporting. • General Expectations: Travel will be required on a case basis. • We want an individual who will embody Maple Reinders core values of: • People- Supporting our people to thrive. • Integrity- Doing the right thing without compromise. • Relationships- Building trust with clients & partners. • Stewardship- Caring for communities & the environment. • Ingenuity- Embracing challenges. Encouraging ideas. Engineering solutions. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
